docTitle.titlePart:
A NEW SCHEME FOR PRACTICAL FLEXIBLE AND INTELLIGENT
VISION SYSTEMS

front.div:
ABSTRACT
We propose a new scheme for practical vision systems which
are simple in structure, directly and adaptively trainable for
various purposes. The feature extraction consists of two stages:
At first, general and primitive features which are shift-invariant
and additive are extracted over the retinal image plane. Then
those features are linearly combined on the bases of multivari-
ate analysis methods so as to provide new effective features for
each task. Such a system can adaptively and automatically
learn the task from the given supervised training examples and
show an intelligent performance. Some examples of practical
applications to object recognition and measurements are exper-
imentally shown.
